required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PREvention of VENous Thromboembolism In Hemorrhagic Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: PREvention of VENous Thromboembolism In Hemorrhagic Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with cerebral hemorrhage (ICH) have a high risk of venous thromboembolism. Intermittent pneumatic compression combined with elastic stockings have been shown to be superior to elastic stockings alone in reducing the rate of asymptomatic deep vein thrombosis after ICH in a randomized trial (4.7% vs. 15.9%). Graduated compression stockings alone are ineffective in preventing deep vein thrombosis in patients with ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke. Less clear is the role of anticoagulation in the prevention of venous thromboembolism in patients with ICH because the use of anticoagulants may cause an enlargement of the hematoma. In a multicenter, randomized trial, the investigators will assess the efficacy and safety of enoxaparin in the prevention of venous thromboembolism in patients with spontaneous intracerebral hemorrhage. Enoxaparin (40 mg once daily) or standard therapy (graduated compression stockings and/or intermittent pneumatic compression and/or early mobilization) will be given subcutaneously for not less than 10 days beginning after 72 hours from stroke onset.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The trial has been terminated prematurely after the randomization of 73 patients due to a lack of funding.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Symptomatic and Asymptomatic Venous Thromboembolism
primary_outcome.description: Symptomatic venous thromboembolism (deep venous thrombosis and/or pulmonary embolism) and asymptomatic deep venous thrombosis on ultrasound examination

secondary_outcome.description: symptomatic and asymptomatic intra and extracranial bleedings

modified Rankin Scale (mRS) equal to and greater than 3. 0 - No symptoms. - No significant disability. Able to carry out all usual activities, despite some symptoms. - Slight disability. Able to look after own affairs without assistance, but unable to carry out all previous activities. - Moderate disability. Requires some help, but able to walk unassisted. - Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance, and unable to walk unassisted. - Severe disability. Requires constant nursing care and attention, bedridden, incontinent. - Dead.

arm_group.description: Graduated compression stockings and/or intermittent pneumatic compression and/or early mobilization

intervention.description: enoxaparin 0.4 ml sc per day for 10 days started 72 hours after the stroke

intervention.intervention_name: Graduated compression stockings and/or intermittent pneumatic compression and/or early mobilization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Intracranial spontaneous hemorrhage on brain CT scan
- Intracranial hemorrhage during treatment with oral anticoagulants
- Bedridden patients (item 6 of NIHSS: motor leg points 3 or 4 or severe ataxia for cerebellar hemorrhage).
Exclusion Criteria:
- cerebral hemorrhage due to intracranial vascular malformation
- rebleeding on CT scan after 72 hours from stroke (before randomization)

reference.citation: Paciaroni M, Agnelli G, Venti M, Alberti A, Acciarresi M, Caso V. Efficacy and safety of anticoagulants in the prevention of venous thromboembolism in patients with acute cerebral hemorrhage: a meta-analysis of controlled studies. J Thromb Haemost. 2011 May;9(5):893-8. doi: 10.1111/j.1538-7836.2011.04241.x.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
